sense.name: the edge or border of a body of water
sense.examples: The children hunted for crabs along the shore near their summer cottage. Several piers along the lake shore were damaged by the storm. We enjoyed a scenic drive along the shore. The legal definition of the shore is the land bounded between low and high tide. The boat hit an iceberg about a hundred miles off the shores of Newfoundland. (refers to the actual coastline of the country, not the whole nation)

sense.name: a beam or timber used for support
sense.examples: John put up a couple of shores to bear the load of the sagging wall. This wood is not strong enough to make good shores.

sense.name: a country or region bounded by a coast
sense.commentary: SHORE[+location][+physical][+region][+geographical][+boundaries][+coastal] Note: related to Sense 1, but refers to the whole country, not really focused on the literal shoreline of the country.
sense.examples: He left the shores of his native land when he was just a young boy. The ripples of Soviet 'new thinking' finally reached the distant shores of Africa.
